comprehensive_overview: VirtualGL is an open-source toolkit that enables the 3D acceleration of applications that are running on a remote server. It redirects the 3D rendering commands from a Unix/Linux OpenGL application onto a server-side GPU and converts the rendered 3D images into a video stream that is sent to the client-side for display using a high-speed network connection.
core_features: Enables 3D acceleration of applications on remote servers
Supports OpenGL applications on Unix/Linux systems
Transmits rendered 3D images to the client-side for display
